title: Possibly include a field in package.json to indicate dist file?
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

A feature!

**What is the current behavior?**

Per https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/10759, the react and react-dom don't include an `unpkg` field, but their npm packages do include `dist` directories with production and development UMD builds. The prior discussion concluded that, because the development and production builds are very different and it's not clear whether the unpkg default should be dev or production, React doesn't include a field at all and leaves it up to the consumers.

My bias is: I'm working on [observable](https://beta.observablehq.com/), which uses [d3-require](https://github.com/d3/d3-require) to include modules from `unpkg`. People type `require('d3')` and it resolves to `https://unpkg.com/d3` which then redirects to the d3 web-compatible distribution.

People _can_ type `require('react/umd/react.development.js')`, but it's hard to figure that one out - they have to look at unpkg itself and hunt around for those UMDs. So we're considering:

- Hardcoding workarounds for react & react-dom, because they're very popular modules and few people are figuring out how to require them.
- Creating a react wrapper that sets an `unpkg` field and re-points to react
- Submitting another PR to react re-proposing a default export

**What is the expected behavior?**

React and ReactDOM would provide - if not a default - some indication of where their `dist` files and what their meanings are.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**

All?

---

Thanks for all y'all's work on React, it's excellent!
